description:
The second season of Hayate no Gotoku!.

Ever since he first met Nagi Sanzenin, Hayate Ayasaki's life has become increasingly more crazed and chaotic. Which is a bit of a problem, since, as the eccentric heiress' butler/personal bodyguard, he's theoretically supposed to be a stabilizing and protective influence. Unfortunately, Nagi and her friends attract trouble the way dropped lollipops attract dirt, and if Hayate has to take a couple of nasty licks along the way, that's just part of the job. The real sucker punch, though, is that Nagi's increasing attraction to Hayate himself is getting precariously close to transforming their professional relationship into something far less professional and much more like a relationship. Is Hayate up for the emotional perils of a round of "upstairs, downstairs"? Or will the purely physical dangers of life on Her Majesty's Domestic Service do him in first?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Ahegao
tags.description: Features a character making an exaggerated orgasm face.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

She married on December 5, 2012, her 32nd birthday, but later announced her divorce on April 30, 2020.

She was part of the seiyuu unit with [Hitomi Nabatame](https://anilist.co/staff/95184/) called "Hitomi Nabatame to Shizuka Itou" (生天目仁美と伊藤静) under Geneon's cosmic★motion label. Together they are known by the name Hitoshizuku (ひとしずく).

In 2015, she married a man who works in a company outside the voice-acting industry.

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=90) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yahagi_sayuri)

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hatakenjiro) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/hajimemashite_maru/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/15184753)

Kenjirou Hata is a Japanese manga author. He is notable for the creation of the series Hayate the Combat Butler. He likes to collect anime related items, such as figurines. He was once an assistant of [Kouji Kumeta](https://anilist.co/staff/97662/Kouji-Kumeta).  

He is married to the voice actress [Masumi Asano](https://anilist.co/staff/95077/Masumi-Asano).

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1476565711)

Originally an animator. Switched his focus to directing in the late '80s.

__Agency:__ Smile Company (2007-2020)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ELISA_0414) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/elisa_0414/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/elisa.smile.official)__

ＥＬＩＳＡ (エリサ) is a Japanese pop singer and model of elite model management Japan. She debuted with the single, 「 euphoric field feat. ELISA 」.  She knew the pleasure of singing by joined a choir at the age of a seventh grader then played piano from 3 years old. At the age of a ninth grader, she participated in the national choir convention. At the age of a tenth grader, she joined and played opera. Her favorite opera is “The Marriage of Figaro” of Mozart.  She applied for model audition “elite Model Look 2007” to try her possibility at the age of an eleventh grader. The 10 finalists will be elected to the National Convention.  The opera which she sang at the time of audition serves as a major debut in October of the year by an opportunity.  Her debut single is 「euphoric field feat.ELISA 」 (TV Anime “ef-a tale of memories” opening theme) records the 22nd place on ORICON chart at first appearance and a longtime seller becomes it afterwards and records an exceptional world-beater more than 30,000 pieces as a rookie.  She released 2nd single 「HIKARI 」 (TV Anime “Nabari no Ou” ending theme) in May, 2008 and strengthened presence as the singer in a contrastive ballad song with the debut at a stretch. Furthermore, She appeared in “2008 Animelo Summer Live -Challenge-” in August, 2008 and overwhelm about 18,000 people.
In September 2020, Elisa allegedly suffered sexual harassment from her manager. She has terminated her contract with Smile Company.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/meet_sp)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/meet_sp)
